alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 2:05PM MST until January 03 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches. The heaviest snow is expected Tuesday morning. Greatest accumulations are forecast along the southern side of the Mogollon Rim from Williams to Munds Park and Happy Jack to Forest Lakes. Much less accumulation is forecast for the northern side of the Mogollon Rim from Doney Park to Heber. * WHERE...Areas near Flagstaff, Forest Lakes, and Williams. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 5 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery and snow covered road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the Tuesday morning commute. Snow forecast from 11 PM Today to 5 PM Tuesday: Doney Park 1 to 2 inches Flagstaff 2 to 4 inches Forest Lakes 4 to 8 inches Heber-Overgaard 0 to 1 inches Williams 4 to 6 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Western Mogollon Rim
